intro: Thesium racemosum, commonly known as the clustered thesium, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in racemes, which are elongated clusters of flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and leathery, adapted to thrive in well-drained, acidic soils. Thesium racemosum is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, showcasing its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
